overview_of_class:
This course will focus on relationships between electronically mediated musical forms and performance. The primary case study will be electronic dance music (the focus of the professor's research), but other case studies will include video game music and ringtones. Issues, questions, and themes that may arise within the course include (but are not limited to) the following:

  • the effects of recording practices upon musical performance and listening

  • "liveness" and presence within technologically mediated performance

  • interfaces and interaction

  • improvisation, especially as it relates to composition, performance, and technology

  • the nature of the musical object within improvised and technologically mediated performance

  • musical design as performative technology
name: Topics in Sound Studies
topic: Performance and Technology in Electronic Music
subject: SAI
